content: Antigay Ad Says a "Storm Is Gathering" A new homophobic ad will soon be hitting the airwaves on channels like CNN, Fox News, and MSNBC, though some are calling it laughably bad. The commercial, produced by the antigay National Organization for Marriage, shows a group of actors discussing how the "storm is gathering" because same-sex marriage has been legalized in four states. The fake doctors and church attendants discuss how new advances in gay rights will take away their "freedom" and make it impossible for them to discriminate against gays and lesbians. The ad will run in places like New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, and California -- states on the front lines of the marriage-equality movement. To watch the television ad go to > >http://www.advocate.com/news_detail_ektid78207.asp
reply: Antigay Ad Says a "Storm Is Gathering" A new homophobic ad will soon be hitting the airwaves on channels like CNN, Fox News, and MSNBC, though some are calling it laughably bad. The fake doctors and church attendants discuss how new advances in gay rights will take away their "freedom" and make it impossible for them to discriminate against gays and lesbians. The ad will run in places like New Jersey, New York, Rhode Island, and California -- states on the front lines of the marriage-equality movement. To watch the television ad go to > >http://www.advocate.com/news_detail_ektid78207.asp
title: New wave of dishonest B.S. about to flood into your living room.

title: New wave of dishonest B.S. about to flood into your living room.

content: In the past, I expected a level of honesty from Christian organizations and trusted them to be truthful. Now days, I trust their commercials about as much as I trust Pizza Hut's. Come-to-think-of-it, I recently decided to order the new Lasagna from Pizza Hut that they had been advertising as worthy of being served in fine Italian restaurants and was sadly disappointed. Their Lasagna was so greasy & salty that I lost my appetite after the first bite, and was afraid it would harm my dogs if I gave it to them!!! In my opinion, religious organizations that have to use deceitful advertising in order to sway public opinion,,, damage their Christian credibility and become no more meaningful to society than Fred Phelps and his Westboro Baptist Church.
reply: In the past, I expected a level of honesty from Christian organizations and trusted them to be truthful. Now days, I trust their commercials about as much as I trust Pizza Hut's. Come-to-think-of-it, I recently decided to order the new Lasagna from Pizza Hut that they had been advertising as worthy of being served in fine Italian restaurants and was sadly disappointed. Their Lasagna was so greasy & salty that I lost my appetite after the first bite, and was afraid it would harm my dogs if I gave it to them!!! In my opinion, religious organizations that have to use deceitful advertising in order to sway public opinion,,, damage their Christian credibility and become no more meaningful to society than Fred Phelps and his Westboro Baptist Church.
title: New wave of dishonest B.S. about to flood into your living room.

content: quote: Originally posted by 19022583: Isn't this the proper way to go about promoting issues in which one believes? I assume that you have NO complaint about pro-gay forces contributing to what they believe? You only hurt your credibility when you support organizations that stoop to blatant dishonesty to promote their ideals. It shows that you follow the "win at any cost" mentality. An approach I don't recall being promoted in any version of the bible. As a matter of fact, I believe Jesus advised that Satan would use lies to promote his agenda... Are you sure you still want to condone the acts of the National Organization for Marriage? I wish you could all see the expression on my girlfriend's face. She just finished watching NOM's ad... She looks absolutely horrified.
quote: Originally posted by 19022583: Isn't this the proper way to go about promoting issues in which one believes? I assume that you have NO complaint about pro-gay forces contributing to what they believe?

She looks absolutely horrified.

quote: Originally posted by Whirled_Peas: quote: Originally posted by 19022583: Isn't this the proper way to go about promoting issues in which one believes? Not when they have to lie through their teeth and use baseless fear-mongering to do it. You can believe whatever you want. You can tell people what you believe. But you can't present lies as facts.
reply: Uhhh....excuse me, but didn't we just elect a president who's campaign employed the very SAME tactics you deplore? Reckon I didn't hear you on your soap box then, did I?
title: New wave of dishonest B.S. about to flood into your living room.

content: quote: Originally posted by sabow: quote: Originally posted by 19022583: Isn't this the proper way to go about promoting issues in which one believes? I assume that you have NO complaint about pro-gay forces contributing to what they believe? You only hurt your credibility when you support organizations that stoop to blatant dishonesty to promote their ideals. It shows that you follow the "win at any cost" mentality. An approach I don't recall being promoted in any version of the bible. As a matter of fact, I believe Jesus advised that Satan would use lies to promote his agenda... Are you sure you still want to condone the acts of the National Organization for Marriage? I wish you could all see the expression on my girlfriend's face. She just finished watching NOM's ad... She looks absolutely horrified. In WHAT manner did I show even the remotest 'support' for the organization or condone their acts? I believe that they've done little more than most ANY politically motivated group does....including those on the opposite side!
quote: Originally posted by sabow: quote: Originally posted by 19022583: Isn't this the proper way to go about promoting issues in which one believes? I assume that you have NO complaint about pro-gay forces contributing to what they believe? You only hurt your credibility when you support organizations that stoop to blatant dishonesty to promote their ideals. It shows that you follow the "win at any cost" mentality. An approach I don't recall being promoted in any version of the bible. As a matter of fact, I believe Jesus advised that Satan would use lies to promote his agenda... Are you sure you still want to condone the acts of the National Organization for Marriage? I wish you could all see the expression on my girlfriend's face. She just finished watching NOM's ad... She looks absolutely horrified.
